channel.title: Work Blog on Dan Aukes
channel.description: Recent content in Work Blog on Dan Aukes

item.title: Techniques for solving four-bar linkage equations
item.description: Introduction The purpose of this tutorial is to show you the power of sympy for analyzing the math of linkages and kinematics.

item.title: Python and Jupyter in Containers
item.description: Python for me has always been easy to learn, but hard to get working.

item.title: Using ROS2 over VPNs in the Classroom
item.description: The purpose of this tutorial is to provide a way to provide access to ROS2 style data collection between computers, when specific kinds of access to the users’ network is restricted.

item.title: Wrapping up "Flexible Robotics"
item.description: I had the pleasure of teaching a new class called “Flexible Robotics” while on sabbatical at Bilkent University in Ankara, Turkey this Fall.

item.title: Micro Servo Data Collection, Parameter Identification, and Modeling: Parts 5 and 6
item.description: This browser does not support the video tag. Introduction In the last article I took some data from a small, off-the-shelf servo, the SG90, 9 gram micro-servo.

item.title: Micro Servo Data Collection, Parameter Identification, and Modeling: Parts 1-4
item.description: Introduction Finding good information on low-cost servos is difficult. In the next articles, I will describe my informal journey finding and identifying the motor parameters for a SG90 9-gram servo motor.

item.title: Adjusting Gait Timing with an ESP32-based Web Framework in MicroPython
item.description: I have been working on this for a while… For the past two Summers I have been teaching a summer camp about “foldable robots”; I teach kids how to make mechanisms with folded cardboard and paper.

item.title: Simulating Spherical Mechanisms in MuJoCo
item.description: Introduction The purpose of this example is to show how easy it is to create spherical mechanisms in MuJoCo.

item.title: Two new videos
item.description: I have created two new tutorial videos for modeling complex 3D kinematics in CAD.

item.title: Quaternion Tutorials
item.description: I am adding a module on quaternions to my flexible robotics class, and am pretty happy with the way it is turning out.

item.title: Demonstrating Unicast in ROS2 with CycloneDDS
item.description: This has been converted to a tutorial and moved here

item.title: Flexible Robotics, Mujoco, and Visas
item.description: I arrived at Bilkent University this week, and immediately jumped in to course creation with Onur Ozcan.

item.title: Mujoco Updates
item.description: This week I’ve been learning MuJoCo and have some informal things to share about what I’ve learned so far^[I’m talking about the python interface in this article.

item.title: Updates on MuJoCo
item.description: Installing mujoco on linux with anaconda is not well documented. I’ve gotten an install to work, and finally without many of the hacks recommended around the web.

item.title: Microdot Updates
item.description: I’m slowly trying to merge some existing servo code with a micro web framework called microdot in order to be able to encode “gait” parameters from a webpage on an ESP32.

item.title: Servo Comparison
item.description: When I’m developing a course or camp, I often don’t have time to do in-depth research on parts or to pre-order multiple rounds of test parts in order to properly research what I need.

item.title: First Post
item.description: The idea of this section of my website is to document some of my daily work during my sabbatical year and hopefully onward.
